page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: This area is dominated by two tree covered sandstone outcrops with magnificent views over the Mersey Estuary and surrounding land.The rest of the area is largely covered by farm land and marshes.The block is cut into two by the M56 Motorway which has dramatically reduced traffic and congestion on the other main roads of the area.There are two centres of population,the market town of Frodsham and the village of Helsby.The market takes place every Thursday and draws people from all the surrounding area.There are no major manufacturing industries within the area and most people travel out of the block to work.Farm land forms a major part of land cover with mixed farming being the predominant type.The area is much sort after for residential purposes and is expanding rapidly.
